text:
This report is against the released v1.8 JMeter.  This version was not available
from the pick list above.

In handling a HTTP redirect JMeter uses the port from the original request.  If
the original request is to:
http://domain1.com:5000/page
and the redirect location is:
http://domain2.com:80/page
then JMeter attempts to redirect to:
http://domain2.com:5000/page
creator: bwit@pobox.com

text:
Michal Kostrzewa  reports:

«Hi,
I'd like to ask why in method redirectURL, class HTTPSampler there is no code
about protocol and port? That's why for example this doesn't work:
Request page: http://server:8080/bar/foo
which returns 302 status and header
Location: https://server:8443/foo/bar
Jmeter tries to load http://server:8080/foo/bar instead of
https://server:8443/bar/foo
Why not to add this ?
    URL newUrl = new URL(loc);
      setProtocol(newUrl.getProtocol()); (!)
      setPort(newUrl.getPort());         (!)
      setMethod(GET);
[...]
»

So I'm chaning the summary from "HTTP redirect uses original port number" to
"HTTP redirect uses original port number and protocol".
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
